input.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ master, main ]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        submodules: recursive

    - name: Check file structure
      run: |
        echo "Repository structure:"
        ls -la

    - name: Verify CLAUDE.md exists
      run: |
        if [ -f "CLAUDE.md" ]; then
          echo "✅ CLAUDE.md found"
        else
          echo "❌ CLAUDE.md not found"
          exit 1
        fi

    - name: Check for journal entries
      run: |
        if [ -d "journal" ]; then
          echo "Journal entries:"
          ls -la journal/
        else
          echo "No journal directory found"
        fi

    - name: Check for persona memories
      run: |
        if [ -d "persona" ]; then
          echo "Persona memories:"
          ls -la persona/
        else
          echo "No persona directory found"
        fi

input.content:
name: Sync Claude Knowledge

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily at midnight UTC
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      force_sync:
        description: 'Force full sync'
        type: boolean
        required: false
        default: false

jobs:
  sync-knowledge:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      contents: write

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        submodules: recursive

    - name: Update submodules
      run: |
        git submodule update --init --recursive
        git submodule update --remote --merge

    - name: Check for changes
      id: check_changes
      run: |
        if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
          echo "changes=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "Changes detected in submodules"
        else
          echo "changes=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "No changes detected"
        fi

    - name: Commit and push changes
      if: steps.check_changes.outputs.changes == 'true'
      run: |
        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
        git add -A
        git commit -m "chore: Sync submodules and knowledge base

        Auto-sync performed by GitHub Actions

        Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
        via [Happy](https://happy.engineering)

        Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
        Co-Authored-By: Happy <yesreply@happy.engineering>"
        git push

content.content: File created successfully at: /home/skogix/claude/.github/workflows/sync.yml

input.content:
name: Backup Claude Memory

on:
  push:
    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
    paths:
      - 'journal/**'
      - 'persona/**'
      - 'logs/**'
      - 'CLAUDE.md'
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 */6 * * *'  # Every 6 hours
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  backup:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      contents: write

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Create backup timestamp
      id: timestamp
      run: echo "timestamp=$(date +'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

    - name: Archive memories
      run: |
        mkdir -p backups

        # Archive journal if exists
        if [ -d "journal" ]; then
          tar -czf "backups/journal_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" journal/
          echo "✅ Journal archived"
        fi

        # Archive persona if exists
        if [ -d "persona" ]; then
          tar -czf "backups/persona_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" persona/
          echo "✅ Persona archived"
        fi

        # Archive logs if exists
        if [ -d "logs" ]; then
          tar -czf "backups/logs_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" logs/
          echo "✅ Logs archived"
        fi

    - name: Clean old backups
      run: |
        # Keep only last 10 backups of each type
        for type in journal persona logs; do
          ls -t backups/${type}_*.tar.gz 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs -r rm
        done

    - name: Commit backups
      run: |
        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
        git add backups/
        git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "backup: Archive memories at ${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}

        Automated backup of Claude's knowledge base

        Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
        via [Happy](https://happy.engineering)

        Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
        Co-Authored-By: Happy <yesreply@happy.engineering>"
        git push || echo "No changes to push"

file.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ master, main ]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      # Note: Submodule is private, so we skip it in CI

    - name: Check file structure
      run: |
        echo "Repository structure:"
        ls -la

    - name: Verify CLAUDE.md exists
      run: |
        if [ -f "CLAUDE.md" ]; then
          echo "✅ CLAUDE.md found"
        else
          echo "❌ CLAUDE.md not found"
          exit 1
        fi

    - name: Check for journal entries
      run: |
        if [ -d "journal" ]; then
          echo "Journal entries:"
          ls -la journal/
        else
          echo "No journal directory found"
        fi

    - name: Check for persona memories
      run: |
        if [ -d "persona" ]; then
          echo "Persona memories:"
          ls -la persona/
        else
          echo "No persona directory found"
        fi

    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.PAT || secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        submodules: recursive

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ master, main ]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      # Note: Submodule is private, so we skip it in CI

    - name: Check file structure
      run: |
        echo "Repository structure:"
        ls -la

    - name: Verify CLAUDE.md exists
      run: |
        if [ -f "CLAUDE.md" ]; then
          echo "✅ CLAUDE.md found"
        else
          echo "❌ CLAUDE.md not found"
          exit 1
        fi

    - name: Check for journal entries
      run: |
        if [ -d "journal" ]; then
          echo "Journal entries:"
          ls -la journal/
        else
          echo "No journal directory found"
        fi

    - name: Check for persona memories
      run: |
        if [ -d "persona" ]; then
          echo "Persona memories:"
          ls -la persona/
        else
          echo "No persona directory found"
        fi

file.content:
name: Sync Claude Knowledge

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily at midnight UTC
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      force_sync:
        description: 'Force full sync'
        type: boolean
        required: false
        default: false

jobs:
  sync-knowledge:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      contents: write

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        # Skip submodules as .skogai is private

    - name: Update submodules (if accessible)
      run: |
        # Only update submodules if we have access (local development)
        echo "Note: Submodule sync skipped in CI (private repo)"

    - name: Check for changes
      id: check_changes
      run: |
        if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
          echo "changes=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "Changes detected in submodules"
        else
          echo "changes=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "No changes detected"
        fi

    - name: Commit and push changes
      if: steps.check_changes.outputs.changes == 'true'
      run: |
        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
        git add -A
        git commit -m "chore: Sync submodules and knowledge base

        Auto-sync performed by GitHub Actions

        Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
        via [Happy](https://happy.engineering)

        Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
        Co-Authored-By: Happy <yesreply@happy.engineering>"
        git push

input.old_string:
steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        # Skip submodules as .skogai is private

    - name: Update submodules (if accessible)
      run: |
        # Only update submodules if we have access (local development)
        echo "Note: Submodule sync skipped in CI (private repo)"
input.new_string:
steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.PAT || secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        submodules: recursive

    - name: Update submodules
      run: |
        git submodule update --init --recursive
        git submodule update --remote --merge

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: Sync Claude Knowledge

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily at midnight UTC
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      force_sync:
        description: 'Force full sync'
        type: boolean
        required: false
        default: false

jobs:
  sync-knowledge:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      contents: write

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        # Skip submodules as .skogai is private

    - name: Update submodules (if accessible)
      run: |
        # Only update submodules if we have access (local development)
        echo "Note: Submodule sync skipped in CI (private repo)"

    - name: Check for changes
      id: check_changes
      run: |
        if [ -n "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then
          echo "changes=true" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "Changes detected in submodules"
        else
          echo "changes=false" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "No changes detected"
        fi

    - name: Commit and push changes
      if: steps.check_changes.outputs.changes == 'true'
      run: |
        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
        git add -A
        git commit -m "chore: Sync submodules and knowledge base

        Auto-sync performed by GitHub Actions

        Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
        via [Happy](https://happy.engineering)

        Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
        Co-Authored-By: Happy <yesreply@happy.engineering>"
        git push

lines: -        # Only update submodules if we have access (local development)
-        echo "Note: Submodule sync skipped in CI (private repo)"

content.content:
1→name: Backup Claude Memory
     2→
     3→on:
     4→  push:
     5→    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
     6→    paths:
     7→      - 'journal/**'
     8→      - 'persona/**'
     9→      - 'logs/**'
    10→      - 'CLAUDE.md'
    11→  schedule:
    12→    - cron: '0 */6 * * *'  # Every 6 hours
    13→  workflow_dispatch:
    14→
    15→jobs:
    16→  backup:
    17→    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    18→
    19→    permissions:
    20→      contents: write
    21→
    22→    steps:
    23→    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    24→      with:
    25→        fetch-depth: 0
    26→
    27→    - name: Create backup timestamp
    28→      id: timestamp
    29→      run: echo "timestamp=$(date +'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
    30→
    31→    - name: Archive memories
    32→      run: |
    33→        mkdir -p backups
    34→
    35→        # Archive journal if exists
    36→        if [ -d "journal" ]; then
    37→          tar -czf "backups/journal_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" journal/
    38→          echo "✅ Journal archived"
    39→        fi
    40→
    41→        # Archive persona if exists
    42→        if [ -d "persona" ]; then
    43→          tar -czf "backups/persona_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" persona/
    44→          echo "✅ Persona archived"
    45→        fi
    46→
    47→        # Archive logs if exists
    48→        if [ -d "logs" ]; then
    49→          tar -czf "backups/logs_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" logs/
    50→          echo "✅ Logs archived"
    51→        fi
    52→
    53→    - name: Clean old backups
    54→      run: |
    55→        # Keep only last 10 backups of each type
    56→        for type in journal persona logs; do
    57→          ls -t backups/${type}_*.tar.gz 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs -r rm
    58→        done
    59→
    60→    - name: Commit backups
    61→      run: |
    62→        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
    63→        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"

file.content:
name: Backup Claude Memory

on:
  push:
    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
    paths:
      - 'journal/**'
      - 'persona/**'
      - 'logs/**'
      - 'CLAUDE.md'
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 */6 * * *'  # Every 6 hours
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  backup:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    permissions:
      contents: write

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        fetch-depth: 0

    - name: Create backup timestamp
      id: timestamp
      run: echo "timestamp=$(date +'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

    - name: Archive memories
      run: |
        mkdir -p backups

        # Archive journal if exists
        if [ -d "journal" ]; then
          tar -czf "backups/journal_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" journal/
          echo "✅ Journal archived"
        fi

        # Archive persona if exists
        if [ -d "persona" ]; then
          tar -czf "backups/persona_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" persona/
          echo "✅ Persona archived"
        fi

        # Archive logs if exists
        if [ -d "logs" ]; then
          tar -czf "backups/logs_${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}.tar.gz" logs/
          echo "✅ Logs archived"
        fi

    - name: Clean old backups
      run: |
        # Keep only last 10 backups of each type
        for type in journal persona logs; do
          ls -t backups/${type}_*.tar.gz 2>/dev/null | tail -n +11 | xargs -r rm
        done

    - name: Commit backups
      run: |
        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
        git add backups/
        git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "backup: Archive memories at ${{ steps.timestamp.outputs.timestamp }}

        Automated backup of Claude's knowledge base

        Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
        via [Happy](https://happy.engineering)

        Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
        Co-Authored-By: Happy <yesreply@happy.engineering>"
        git push || echo "No changes to push"

file.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [ master, main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ master, main ]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      with:
        token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        submodules: 'false'

    - name: Checkout submodules
      run: |
        echo "Attempting to checkout submodules..."
        git submodule update --init --recursive || echo "Note: Some submodules may be private and inaccessible"
      continue-on-error: true

    - name: Check file structure
      run: |
        echo "Repository structure:"
        ls -la
